docblock.long-description: In this file there are all the usage examples useful to learn and test all the class methods for the Zm_User class
In this file there are all the usage examples useful to learn and test all the class methods for the Zm_Account, Zm_Server, Zm_Domain and Zm_Auth classes

docblock.description: Zm_Domain is a class which allows to manage Zimbra domains via SOAP
docblock.long-description:
You may create, modify, rename, delete and get the attributes of a Zimbra domain using this class

For the usage examples of all class methods check the source code of test.php

tag.name: param
tag.description: value of the domain (auto, name, id)

tag.name: return
tag.description: an array with the new domain's info

tag.description: an array containing the domain attributes to be set

docblock.description: Zm_Auth is a class which allows to connect to the Zimbra admin or user space via SOAP
docblock.long-description:
Use this class to connect and login to a Zimbra server

Example:

// either authenticate as admin:
$auth = new Zm_Auth($zimbraServer, $zimbraAdminEmail, $zimbraAdminPassword, "admin");
// or authenticate as user:
$auth = new Zm_Auth($zimbraServer, $userEmail, $userPassword, "user");
// then login
$l = $auth->login();
if(is_a($l, "Exception")) {
    echo "Error : cannot login to $zimbraServer\n";
    echo $l->getMessage()."\n";
    exit();
}

tag.name: param
tag.description: authenticate as admin or user (default admin)

docblock.description: Use this method to login to a Zimbra server after you create an instance of this class
Zm_User is a class which allows a Zimbra user to manage its own account via SOAP
docblock.long-description:
You may change password, modify and get the preferences of a Zimbra user using this class

For the usage examples of all class methods check the source code of testuser.php

tag.name: param
tag.description: an array containing the user prefs to be set
